verses.text_plain: Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king’s heart was toward Absalom.
verses.verse_html: 1Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king’s heart was toward Absalom.

verses.text_plain: And Joab sent to Tekoah, and fetched thence a wise woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:
verses.verse_html: 2And Joab sent to Tekoah, and fetched thence a wise woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:

tokens.text: unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner

verses.text_plain: And come to the king, and speak on this manner unto him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.
verses.verse_html: 3And come to the king, and speak on this manner unto him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.

verses.text_plain: And when the woman of Tekoah spake to the king, she fell on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O king.
verses.verse_html:
4And when the woman of Tekoah spake to the king, she fell on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O king. ▼
▼ Help: Heb. Save

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, I am indeed a widow woman, and mine husband is dead.
verses.verse_html: 5And the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, I am indeed a widow woman, and mine husband is dead.

tokens.text: unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered

verses.text_plain: And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one smote the other, and slew him.
verses.verse_html:
6And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one smote the other, and slew him. ▼
▼ none…: Heb. no deliverer between them

footnotes.body_text: ▼ none…: Heb. no deliverer between them
footnotes.body_html: ▼ none…: Heb. no deliverer between them

verses.text_plain: And, behold, the whole family is risen against thine handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him, for the life of his brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left, and shall not leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the earth.
verses.verse_html:
7And, behold, the whole family is risen against thine handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him, for the life of his brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left, and shall not leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the earth. ▼
▼ upon…: Heb. upon the face of the earth

tokens.text: also: and so they shall quench

footnotes.body_text: ▼ upon…: Heb. upon the face of the earth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ upon…: Heb. upon the face of the earth

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto the woman, Go to thine house, and I will give charge concerning thee.
verses.verse_html: 8And the king said unto the woman, Go to thine house, and I will give charge concerning thee.

verses.text_plain: And the woman of Tekoah said unto the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father’s house: and the king and his throne be guiltless.
verses.verse_html: 9And the woman of Tekoah said unto the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father’s house: and the king and his throne be guiltless.

tokens.text: on me, and on my father’s

verses.text_plain: And the king said, Whosoever saith ought unto thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.
verses.verse_html: 10And the king said, Whosoever saith ought unto thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.

tokens.text: him to me, and he shall not touch

verses.text_plain: Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember the Lord thy God, that thou wouldest not suffer the revengers of blood to destroy any more, lest they destroy my son. And he said, As the Lord liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth.
verses.verse_html:
11Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember the Lord thy God, that thou wouldest not suffer the revengers of blood to destroy any more, lest they destroy my son. And he said, As the Lord liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth. ▼
▼ that…: Heb. that the revenger of blood do not multiply to destroy

tokens.text: she, I pray thee, let the king
that thou wouldest not suffer the revengers

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that…: Heb. that the revenger of blood do not multiply to destroy
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that…: Heb. that the revenger of blood do not multiply to destroy

verses.text_plain: Then the woman said, Let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak one word unto my lord the king. And he said, Say on.
verses.verse_html: 12Then the woman said, Let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak one word unto my lord the king. And he said, Say on.

verses.text_plain: And the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God? for the king doth speak this thing as one which is faulty, in that the king doth not fetch home again his banished.
verses.verse_html: 13And the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God? for the king doth speak this thing as one which is faulty, in that the king doth not fetch home again his banished.

tokens.text: such a thing against the people

verses.text_plain: For we must needs die, and are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again; neither doth God respect any person: yet doth he devise means, that his banished be not expelled from him.
verses.verse_html:
14For we must needs die, and are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again; neither doth God respect any person: yet doth he devise means, that his banished be not expelled from him. ▼
▼ neither…: or, because God hath not taken away his life, he hath also devised means, etc

tokens.text: which cannot be gathered up again

footnotes.body_text: ▼ neither…: or, because God hath not taken away his life, he hath also devised means, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ neither…: or, because God hath not taken away his life, he hath also devised means, etc

verses.text_plain: Now therefore that I am come to speak of this thing unto my lord the king, it is because the people have made me afraid: and thy handmaid said, I will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king will perform the request of his handmaid.
verses.verse_html: 15Now therefore that I am come to speak of this thing unto my lord the king, it is because the people have made me afraid: and thy handmaid said, I will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king will perform the request of his handmaid.

tokens.text: Now therefore that I am come
it may be that the king

verses.text_plain: For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.
verses.verse_html: 16For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.

verses.text_plain: Then thine handmaid said, The word of my lord the king shall now be comfortable: for as an angel of God, so is my lord the king to discern good and bad: therefore the Lord thy God will be with thee.
verses.verse_html:
17Then thine handmaid said, The word of my lord the king shall now be comfortable: for as an angel of God, so is my lord the king to discern good and bad: therefore the Lord thy God will be with thee. ▼
▼ comfortable: Heb. for rest
 , ▼
▼ to discern: Heb. to hear

footnotes.body_html: ▼ comfortable: Heb. for rest
▼ to discern: Heb. to hear

verses.text_plain: Then the king answered and said unto the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.
verses.verse_html: 18Then the king answered and said unto the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.

tokens.text: not from me, I pray thee, the thing

verses.text_plain: And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with thee in all this? And the woman answered and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought that my lord the king hath spoken: for thy servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thine handmaid:
verses.verse_html: 19And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with thee in all this? And the woman answered and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought that my lord the king hath spoken: for thy servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thine handmaid:

tokens.text: with thee in all this? And the woman

verses.text_plain: To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.
verses.verse_html: 20To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom again.
verses.verse_html: 21And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom again.

verses.text_plain: And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself, and thanked the king: and Joab said, To day thy servant knoweth that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant.
verses.verse_html:
22And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself, and thanked the king: and Joab said, To day thy servant knoweth that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant. ▼
▼ thanked: Heb. blessed
 , ▼
▼ his servant: or, thy servant

footnotes.body_html: ▼ his servant: or, thy servant

verses.text_plain: So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 23So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: And the king said, Let him turn to his own house, and let him not see my face. So Absalom returned to his own house, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.verse_html: 24And the king said, Let him turn to his own house, and let him not see my face. So Absalom returned to his own house, and saw not the king’s face.

verses.text_plain: But in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Absalom for his beauty: from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him.
verses.verse_html:
25But in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Absalom for his beauty: from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him. ▼
▼ But…: Heb. And as Absalom there was not a beautiful man in all Israel to praise greatly

tokens.text: even to the crown of his head

footnotes.body_text: ▼ But…: Heb. And as Absalom there was not a beautiful man in all Israel to praise greatly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ But…: Heb. And as Absalom there was not a beautiful man in all Israel to praise greatly

verses.text_plain: And when he polled his head, (for it was at every year’s end that he polled it: because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he polled it:) he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels after the king’s weight.
verses.verse_html: 26And when he polled his head, (for it was at every year’s end that he polled it: because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he polled it:) he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels after the king’s weight.

tokens.text: for it was at every year’s

verses.text_plain: And unto Absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter, whose name was Tamar: she was a woman of a fair countenance.
verses.verse_html: 27And unto Absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter, whose name was Tamar: she was a woman of a fair countenance.

verses.text_plain: So Absalom dwelt two full years in Jerusalem, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.verse_html: 28So Absalom dwelt two full years in Jerusalem, and saw not the king’s face.

verses.text_plain: Therefore Absalom sent for Joab, to have sent him to the king; but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time, he would not come.
verses.verse_html: 29Therefore Absalom sent for Joab, to have sent him to the king; but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time, he would not come.

tokens.text: to him: and when he sent again

verses.text_plain: Therefore he said unto his servants, See, Joab’s field is near mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. And Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.
verses.verse_html:
30Therefore he said unto his servants, See, Joab’s field is near mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. And Absalom’s servants set the field on fire. ▼
▼ near…: Heb. near my place

footnotes.body_html: ▼ near…: Heb. near my place

verses.text_plain: Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto his house, and said unto him, Wherefore have thy servants set my field on fire?
verses.verse_html: 31Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto his house, and said unto him, Wherefore have thy servants set my field on fire?

tokens.text: unto him, Wherefore have thy servants

verses.text_plain: And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent unto thee, saying, Come hither, that I may send thee to the king, to say, Wherefore am I come from Geshur? it had been good for me to have been there still: now therefore let me see the king’s face; and if there be any iniquity in me, let him kill me.
verses.verse_html: 32And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent unto thee, saying, Come hither, that I may send thee to the king, to say, Wherefore am I come from Geshur? it had been good for me to have been there still: now therefore let me see the king’s face; and if there be any iniquity in me, let him kill me.

tokens.text: there still: now therefore let me see

verses.text_plain: So Joab came to the king, and told him: and when he had called for Absalom, he came to the king, and bowed himself on his face to the ground before the king: and the king kissed Absalom.
verses.verse_html: 33So Joab came to the king, and told him: and when he had called for Absalom, he came to the king, and bowed himself on his face to the ground before the king: and the king kissed Absalom.

tokens.text: him: and when he had called
